stitch notions pm place marker repeat - repeat you should be able to use any dk yarn my testers used all different types with great success just check your head measurements and allow a little for stretch and sewing together if you have any queries about the pattern please contact me on laboursoflovecrochet@gmail com or @laboursoflovecrochet on instagram pattern notes & gauge before you begin measure your head and select a hook that is suitable for your yarn gauge - body of pattern = 5cm after 10 row  if you adjust the length or width to suit you remember to keep work in multiples of two for the pattern repeat on the row of half_double_crochet and slip_stitch and add 1  headband pattern is worked in row ©labours of love crochet - 2020 page 1 rosalie twisted headband  my head is approximately 22 so i did a fhdc of 76 + 1 = 77 which was approx 22 laid flat this will pull in a little with the stitches and the twist to give a snug fit adjust the number of stitches to suit your size/yarn/gauge headband row 1 fhdc to the required length multiples of 2 plus 1 turn 77 row 2 chain 1 half_double_crochet into same st pm*slip_stitch in next st half_double_crochet in next st repeat from * to end ending on a half_double_crochet turn 77 you work the half_double_crochet into the corresponding half_double_crochet from the previous row row 3 repeat row 2 for 18 row or until desired width row 19 chain 1 half_double_crochet into same st half_double_crochet in each st 77 leave a long tail to join the headband ©labours of love crochet - 2020 page 2 rosalie twisted headband joining get both ends of the headband and fold in half without twisting cup the two ends together and hold fig 1&2 fig 1 fig 2 with the tail sew through all 4 ends fig 3 & 4 fig 4 fig 3 sew in ends and invert the headband to reveal the twist fig 5 & 6 fig 5 fig 6 now you can add to your rosalie set with the #rosaliefingerlessgloves and headband i would love to see your versions if you post on instagram please use the tag #rosalietwistedheadband and tag me @laboursoflovecrochet so i can see them ©labours of love crochet -
